intro: Senebiera pinnatifida var. australis, commonly known as the Australian senebiera, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Argentina and Chile. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant is often found in dry, sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been introduced to other regions for horticultural purposes. Its growth habit includes a woody stem with branching patterns that contribute to its distinctive appearance.
